description: IBM develops CP-40 (later CP-67), pioneering full hardware virtualization on mainframes.
IBM releases VM/370, the first widely deployed commercial VM OS for System/370.
VMware is founded by Diane Greene, Mendel Rosenblum and others, accelerating x86 virtualization.
VMware ships its first x86 virtualization product.
FreeBSD 4.0 introduces 'jails', providing early OS-level process isolation.
Xen hypervisor publicly released, enabling paravirtualized and full virtualization on x86.
KVM integrated into Linux kernel v2.6.20, enabling Linux to act as a native hypervisor.
Linux Containers emerge through cgroups and namespaces, providing OS-level isolation.
Intel introduces VT-x hardware virtualization extensions to reduce VM/host transition costs.
AMD releases AMD-V hardware virtualization extensions.
Docker introduces a modern workflow for application containers using layered images.
AWS Lambda introduces serverless computing—event-driven execution without servers.
Terraform introduces cloud-vendor-agnostic infrastructure-as-code.
Packer reaches 1.0, automating VM, cloud image, and container image creation.
Nomad introduces flexible cluster scheduling for both VMs and containers.
Google Cloud Functions reaches GA, expanding serverless to multi-cloud ecosystems.
AWS releases Firecracker for lightweight, secure microVMs powering serverless workloads.
Crossplane turns Kubernetes into a universal cloud control plane for multi-cloud IaC.
The Ideal Versus the Real – Revisiting the History of Virtual Machines and Containers published.
arXiv 2401.07539 reports up to 50% performance gains when running containers on bare-metal vs VMs.
Study comparing hypervisors, containers, microVMs, and energy use in edge & cloud environments.

content: Real-Time Workloads: Containers vs Unikernels vs VMs
description: Analysis shows unikernels and microVMs rival containers for predictable latency.
Research proposes hybrid container/unikernel architectures for IoT and edge deployments.

content: Container & VM Performance in Automotive Systems
description: Study evaluates container and VM performance on ARM64/AMD64 for software-defined vehicle workloads.
2025 benchmark paper analyzes how container image structure impacts performance across workloads.
